title: oc 4.5.7 dc 1.2.1: can't upload files without name (e.g. .htaccess, .ds_store)
body:
### expected behaviour
when i upload a file without a name, such as '.htaccess' (which is a common file used for website's) or '.ds_store' it should upload to my oc-server and appear at others in the shared folder. i used a .htaccess file for example in the log file (see rule 72).

### actual behaviour
nothing happens, the file isn't uploaded to the server at all. i can't get a .htaccess file or a .ds_store file uploaded via the desktop client, neither can i via the webclient.

### steps to reproduce
1. install oc-client & set-up a sync
2. place a file without a file name (so, with only an extension) in your sync folder.
2a. log-in to your webclient and press upload.
3. look at your oc-server and see that nothing's there.
3a. see the loading circle load forever.

### server configuration
operating system: ubuntu 12.04 lts

web server: apache2

database: mysql 5.5

php version: 5.3

owncloud version: 4.5.7

### client configuration
client version: 1.2.1

operating system: windows 7 home

os language: dutch

installation path of client: c:\program files (x86)\owncloud

### logs

#### output of `owncloud --logwindow` or `owncloud --logfile log.txt`
